NOTE: Don't confuse with {AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount}."}],"AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount(address,bytes32)":[{"details":"The `account` is missing a role."}],"AddressEmptyCode(address)":[{"details":"There's no code at `target` (it is not a contract)."}],"ERC1967InvalidImplementation(address)":[{"details":"The `implementation` of the proxy is invalid."}],"ERC1967NonPayable()":[{"details":"An upgrade function sees `msg.value > 0` that may be lost."}],"FailedCall()":[{"details":"A call to an address target failed. The target may have reverted."}],"InvalidInitialization()":[{"details":"The contract is already initialized."}],"NotInitializing()":[{"details":"The contract is not initializing."}],"UUPSUnauthorizedCallContext()":[{"details":"The call is from an unauthorized context."}],"UUPSUnsupportedProxiableUUID(bytes32)":[{"details":"The storage `slot` is unsupported as a UUID."}]},"events":{"Initialized(uint64)":{"details":"Triggered when the contract has been initialized or reinitialized."},"RoleAdminChanged(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32)":{"details":"Emitted when `newAdminRole` is set as ``role``'s admin role, replacing `previousAdminRole` `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` is the starting admin for all roles, despite {RoleAdminChanged} not being emitted to signal this."},"RoleGranted(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is granted `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call. This account bears the admin role (for the granted role). Expected in cases where the role was granted using the internal {AccessControl-_grantRole}."},"RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)"},"Upgraded(address)":{"details":"Emitted when the implementation is upgraded."}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"addMargin(bytes32,uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"The amount of margin to add (in quote currency value, 1e18).","marketId":"The ID of the market for the position."}},"closePosition(bytes32,uint128,uint256)":{"params":{"marketId":"The ID of the perpetual market.","priceLimitX18":"The price limit for the trade (slippage protection).","size":"The amount of base asset to trade for closing the position."}},"deposit(address,uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"The amount of the token to deposit.","token":"The address of the ERC20 token to deposit."}},"getAccountValue(address)":{"details":"This is a simplification; a full implementation would sum collateral and unrealized PnL across all positions.","params":{"account":"The address of the user."},"returns":{"_0":"The account value."}},"getMaintenanceMargin(address,bytes32)":{"params":{"account":"The address of the user.","marketId":"The ID of the market."},"returns":{"_0":"The maintenance margin amount."}},"getMarginRatio(address,bytes32)":{"params":{"account":"The address of the user.","marketId":"The ID of the market."},"returns":{"_0":"The margin ratio (margin / notional value)."}},"getNotional(address,bytes32)":{"params":{"account":"The address of the user.","marketId":"The ID of the market."},"returns":{"_0":"The notional value of the position."}},"getPosition(address,bytes32)":{"params":{"account":"The address of the user.","marketId":"The ID of the market."},"returns":{"_0":"The PositionView struct containing position details."}},"getRoleAdmin(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}."},"grantRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event."},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"initialize(address,address,address)":{"params":{"_marketRegistry":"The address of the MarketRegistry contract.","_vault":"The address of the CollateralVault contract.","admin":"The address that will receive the default admin role."}},"isLiquidatable(address,bytes32)":{"params":{"account":"The address of the user.","marketId":"The ID of the market."},"returns":{"_0":"A boolean indicating if the position is liquidatable."}},"liquidate(address,bytes32,uint128)":{"details":"Can only be called by a whitelisted liquidator.","params":{"account":"The address of the user whose position is being liquidated.","marketId":"The ID of the market.","size":"The amount of the position to liquidate."}},"openPosition(bytes32,bool,uint128,uint256)":{"params":{"isLong":"True for a long position, false for a short position.","marketId":"The ID of the perpetual market.","priceLimitX18":"The price limit for the trade (slippage protection).","size":"The amount of base asset to trade."}},"pauseMarket(bytes32,bool)":{"details":"Thin wrapper around MarketRegistry's pauseMarket function. Only callable by an admin.","params":{"marketId":"The ID of the market.","paused":"True to pause, false to unpause."}},"proxiableUUID()":{"details":"Implementation of the ERC-1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier."},"removeMargin(bytes32,uint256)":{"details":"Checks that removing margin does not leave the position below the maintenance margin requirement.","params":{"amount":"The amount of margin to remove (in quote currency value, 1e18).","marketId":"The ID of the market for the position."}},"removeWhitelistedLiquidator(address)":{"params":{"liquidator":"The address to remove."}},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"setRiskParams(bytes32,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"imrBps":"The initial margin requirement in basis points.","liquidationPenaltyBps":"The liquidation penalty in basis points.","marketId":"The ID of the market.","mmrBps":"The maintenance margin requirement in basis points.","penaltyCap":"The maximum liquidation penalty in quote units (1e18)."}},"setWhitelistedLiquidator(address,bool)":{"params":{"isWhitelisted":"The whitelist status.","liquidator":"The address to whitelist."}},"settleFunding(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Updates the user's margin based on the funding rate since their last settlement.","params":{"account":"The address of the user.","marketId":"The ID of the perpetual market."}},"supportsInterface(bytes4)":{"details":"Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[ERC section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas."},"upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes)":{"custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow-reachable":"delegatecall","details":"Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event."},"withdraw(address,uint256)":{"details":"Checks that the withdrawal does not compromise the user's total reserved margin.","params":{"amount":"The amount of the token to withdraw.","token":"The address of the ERC20 token to withdraw."}}},"version":1},"userdoc":{"kind":"user","methods":{"WhitelistedLiquidators(address)":{"notice":"Mapping of whitelisted liquidator addresses."},"_totalReservedMargin(address)":{"notice":"Mapping of total margin reserved by a user across all their positions."},"addMargin(bytes32,uint256)":{"notice":"Adds margin to a specific position from the user's available collateral."},"closePosition(bytes32,uint128,uint256)":{"notice":"Closes or reduces an existing position in a perpetual market."},"deposit(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Deposits collateral into the vault for the caller."},"getAccountValue(address)":{"notice":"Gets the total value of a user's account."},"getMaintenanceMargin(address,bytes32)":{"notice":"Gets the maintenance margin required for a position."},"getMarginRatio(address,bytes32)":{"notice":"Gets the margin ratio for a user's position."},"getNotional(address,bytes32)":{"notice":"Gets the notional value of a user's position in a market."},"getPosition(address,bytes32)":{"notice":"Gets the position details for a user in a specific market."},"initialize(address,address,address)":{"notice":"Initializer replacing constructor for upgradeable deployment."},"isLiquidatable(address,bytes32)":{"notice":"Checks if an account's position in a given market is subject to liquidation."},"liquidate(address,bytes32,uint128)":{"notice":"Liquidates a position that is below the maintenance margin requirement."},"marketRegistry()":{"notice":"Address of the market registry contract."},"marketRiskParams(bytes32)":{"notice":"Mapping of risk parameters for each market."},"openPosition(bytes32,bool,uint128,uint256)":{"notice":"Opens a new position or increases an existing one in a perpetual market."},"pauseMarket(bytes32,bool)":{"notice":"Pauses or unpauses a market."},"positions(address,bytes32)":{"notice":"Mapping from user address to their position in a specific market."},"removeMargin(bytes32,uint256)":{"notice":"Removes margin from a specific position, making it available for withdrawal or use in other positions."},"removeWhitelistedLiquidator(address)":{"notice":"Removes an address from the liquidator vault contract."},"withdraw(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Withdraws collateral from the vault for the caller."}},"notice":"The central contract for managing user positions, margin, and trade settlement params.amount: The amount of margin to add (in quote currency value, 1e18).
params.marketId: The ID of the market for the position.
The ID of the perpetual market.
params.priceLimitX18: The price limit for the trade (slippage protection).
params.size: The amount of base asset to trade for closing the position.

params.amount: The amount of the token to deposit.
params.token: The address of the ERC20 token to deposit.

getAccountValue(address).details: This is a simplification; a full implementation would sum collateral and unrealized PnL across all positions.

returns._0: The notional value of the position.
The PositionView struct containing position details.

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

params._marketRegistry: The address of the MarketRegistry contract.
params._vault: The address of the CollateralVault contract.
params.admin: The address that will receive the default admin role.

returns._0: A boolean indicating if the position is liquidatable.

liquidate(address,bytes32,uint128).details: Can only be called by a whitelisted liquidator.

params.account: The address of the user whose position is being liquidated.
params.size: The amount of the position to liquidate.

params.isLong: True for a long position, false for a short position.
params.marketId: The ID of the perpetual market.
params.priceLimitX18: The price limit for the trade (slippage protection).
params.size: The amount of base asset to trade.

pauseMarket(bytes32,bool).details: Thin wrapper around MarketRegistry's pauseMarket function. Only callable by an admin.

params.paused: True to pause, false to unpause.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC-1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

removeMargin(bytes32,uint256).details: Checks that removing margin does not leave the position below the maintenance margin requirement.

params.amount: The amount of margin to remove (in quote currency value, 1e18).
params.marketId: The ID of the market for the position.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

params.imrBps: The initial margin requirement in basis points.
params.liquidationPenaltyBps: The liquidation penalty in basis points.
params.mmrBps: The maintenance margin requirement in basis points.
params.penaltyCap: The maximum liquidation penalty in quote units (1e18).

settleFunding(bytes32,address).details: Updates the user's margin based on the funding rate since their last settlement.

params.marketId: The ID of the perpetual market.

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[ERC section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

withdraw(address,uint256).details: Checks that the withdrawal does not compromise the user's total reserved margin.

params.amount: The amount of the token to withdraw.
params.token: The address of the ERC20 token to withdraw.

_totalReservedMargin(address).notice: Mapping of total margin reserved by a user across all their positions.

addMargin(bytes32,uint256).notice: Adds margin to a specific position from the user's available collateral.

closePosition(bytes32,uint128,uint256).notice: Closes or reduces an existing position in a perpetual market.

deposit(address,uint256).notice: Deposits collateral into the vault for the caller.

getAccountValue(address).notice: Gets the total value of a user's account.

getMaintenanceMargin(address,bytes32).notice: Gets the maintenance margin required for a position.

getMarginRatio(address,bytes32).notice: Gets the margin ratio for a user's position.

getNotional(address,bytes32).notice: Gets the notional value of a user's position in a market.

getPosition(address,bytes32).notice: Gets the position details for a user in a specific market.

initialize(address,address,address).notice: Initializer replacing constructor for upgradeable deployment.

isLiquidatable(address,bytes32).notice: Checks if an account's position in a given market is subject to liquidation.

liquidate(address,bytes32,uint128).notice: Liquidates a position that is below the maintenance margin requirement.

marketRegistry().notice: Address of the market registry contract.

marketRiskParams(bytes32).notice: Mapping of risk parameters for each market.

openPosition(bytes32,bool,uint128,uint25.notice: Opens a new position or increases an existing one in a perpetual market.

positions(address,bytes32).notice: Mapping from user address to their position in a specific market.

removeMargin(bytes32,uint256).notice: Removes margin from a specific position, making it available for withdrawal or use in other positions.

removeWhitelistedLiquidator(address).notice: Removes an address from the liquidator whitelist.

setRiskParams(bytes32,uint256,uint256,ui.notice: Sets the risk parameters for a market.

setWhitelistedLiquidator(address,bool).notice: Whitelists an address, allowing it to call liquidation functions.

settleFunding(bytes32,address).notice: Settles funding payments for a user in a perpetual market.

vault().notice: Address of the collateral vault contract.

withdraw(address,uint256).notice: Withdraws collateral from the vault for the caller.
